means: 责怪或处罚某人不当（使之受冤或代人受过）( victimize的过去式和过去分词 )
不正当地使某人受损害或受苦难，欺负某人

sentence.Network_en: The lads don't join the union because they're frightened of being victimized.
sentence.Network_cn: 那几个伙计没加入工会是因为害怕成为牺牲品。

sentence.Network_en: For years the family had been victimized by racist neighbours.
sentence.Network_cn: 多年来这家人因邻居怀有种族偏见而饱受欺凌。

sentence.Network_en: I was victimized the whole evening by his loquacity.
sentence.Network_cn: 整个晚上我都被他的吵嚷不休所困扰.

PerfectNetExp.abs: put aside the whole story of being wronged and victimized , then have an honest , heartfelt conversation with yourself asking what you really want your life to be about .把那些被冤枉和成为受害者的故事放一边，然后和自己有一个诚实的，真诚的对话，问一下你自己在生命中你最想要的是什么？

entry.def: If someone is victimized, they are deliberately treated unfairly.

example.ex: He felt the students had been victimized because they'd  voiced opposition to the government.
example.tran: 他觉得学生们受到迫害是因为他们表达了对政府的不满。

sentences.sentence: "after going out of his way to help his friend get the job he felt not appreciated but used"
